title: Help Center tiles vertical centering and hover tooltip for full titles

requirements.summary: Visually vertically center the logo/text block within each Help Center topic tile by reducing excess top space to match the bottom space (layout/styling only in HelpCenter tiles).
acceptanceCriteria: In the Help Center grid, each tileâ€™s visible padding/space above the logo/text matches the visible space below it (content appears vertically centered).
Only layout/styling changes are made; no changes to backend calls, React Query hooks, component state, or click behavior.
Tile still opens the topic detail modal on click exactly as before.

file_operations.description: Adjust only the tile markup/classes in the topics grid so the tile's content sits visually centered vertically (e.g., reduce the CardContent top padding and/or use flex alignment on CardContent), without changing any props/state/data fetching or onClick behavior.

requirements.summary: Add a lightweight text-only hover tooltip for each Help Center topic tile showing the full topic.topicName without affecting tile layout or click behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: Hovering a Help Center tile reveals the full topic title (including titles that are truncated in the tile).
Tooltip is text-only and does not block or prevent clicking the tile to open the modal.
No changes are made outside of what is necessary to implement the hover title behavior on Help Center tiles.

file_operations.description: Add a non-intrusive hover tooltip for each tile that displays the full topic.topicName (prefer a native, text-only tooltip via a title attribute on the clickable tile container or the truncated title element) ensuring it does not intercept pointer events or change layout, and preserving existing click-to-open-modal behavior.
